title: Administrative Associate III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stanford University in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online and received a call from a recruiter the following Friday. Received a second contact the very next Monday setting up four interviews between Tuesday and Wednesday of the same week. Completed interviews and received email requesting references Wednesday evening. All references submitted Thursday morning and offer extended Thursday afternoon. 

It was a dream scenario. Not a lot of waiting and frequent communication.
Interview Questions:
1. Describe the best and worst boss you have in the past. 
2. How do you keep organized? 
3. What softwares have your previously worked with?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I first got an assignment and then moved on to a panel interview. There was another step after that, but I didn't make it this far. Wait between each step was extremely long, and it was hard to get updates.
Interview Questions: The assignment involved summarizing an article and completing a coding task. The panel interview comprised both behavioral and technical aspects

title: Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: Standard screening interview, 1:1 with manager, panel interview, followed by writing test. It was rigorous without being overly demanding. I was pleased with how quickly the process developed after initial contact.
Interview Questions: What was a challenge and how did I overcome it?

title: Paralegal Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an online application through Stanford's website. They responded by emailing me an invitation to interview. I selected a convenient time and met for half an hour on Zoom.
Interview Questions: In this role you would be helping students learn, what experience do you have training new persons?

title: Forestry Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University (York Nw Salem, PA)
Interview Descriptions: The first stage of the interview process was meeting the hiring manager and exchanging introductions followed by different. ...helpful I enjoyed the interview and learning about the role and company.
Interview Questions: strength, weakness, cognitive questions, salary

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Madison, WI) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: I gave a research talk about my PhD research. They asked pertinent question about my research. I then spoke about why I wanted to join their lab and they asked questions about what kind of projects in their lab I might be interested in.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in our lab?

title: Diversity Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Applied for role online for the Wu Tsai Neuroscience Institute. Got an email from HR to set-up a phone screening and then met with the hiring manager and institute's director. I took the interview call while I was traveling so wifi was a little spotty, but the hiring manager, who was just recently hired at Wu Tsai was short and impatient. Given it was only a 30 minute call, she cut me short while covering my background and experience in DEI and mental health and I just feel I was not given a fair chance in the interview. Hours later I got the rejection email.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself/your background

title: Communication Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stanford University (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Had a quick call after a recruiter reached out. Was clear to both of us it was not a great fit but the recruiter was kind and provided great insight into the role.
Interview Questions: Do you have any additional questions about the role or want to highlight something we didn't go over to help you stand out to the hiring manager?

title: Post Doctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is a multiple-stage process for hiring new employees. The stages mainly comprise job interviews held either one-on-one, with a group of candidates, or with a panel. Interviews are conducted in person, over the phone or by email, or via video conferencing tools.
Interview Questions: what was your field of interest?

title: Administration Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Applied one month before. Then it was a phone screening by hr first. Then 2 back to back zoom meetings. Then it was an in person 1 hour long interview with the department chair. The interviewers were nice enough.
Interview Questions: What is one mistake I made in the job and how I fixed or improved from it.

title: Membership Services Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process included one, roughly 30-minute meeting with the manager and involved several behavioral and logistical questions to help gauge whether I had experience with or interest in a customer-facing role.
Interview Questions: What's one thing you are hoping to learn in this position?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Expect a long drawn out interview process. Sometimes it is shorter. Stanford does not move quickly with most things. Be patient. Keep in touch with recruiter. Be sure to share that you want stability and are interested long term.
Interview Questions: Very standard "Tell me about a time when..."

title: Undergraduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with a Stanford alumna during my senior year of high school. The interviewer was amiable. She met me outside of a cafe and talked to me casually about my interests, long-term goals, and perspectives.
Interview Questions: One question I was asked which I found unique was a question pertaining to social media and my use of social media.

title: Executive Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Screened by a department director. Given administrative tasks to complete remotely - prepare an email response, create minutes from a video meeting, tally an order in excel (formulas) to name a few.
Interview Questions: Why I am interested in working for the department.

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Redwood City, CA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Thorough and informative interview panel. The panel members Explained Job expectations and the upcoming projects each team member would be involved in during the upcoming year. Each panel member came up with very unique questions that really helped them find a good fit for the culture
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you for this position?

title: System Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: After recruiter picked my profile and reached out to me and after 2 interviews with director and manager on separate days , during third interview- I was told that “I am doing something very different from what they do” by a team member. what changed within 2 days? They need better screening process. If you need a team member to evaluate- let the team member conduct the first interview. I have never seen a Panel interview with 7 interviewers with 1 interviewee. I was given no idea about what I will be asked nor that I will be interviewed by 7 people at the same time in one hour. Interviewers were condescending. It was insane- a mix of technical, behavioral and random questions with preconceived notion about what I am capable of instead of asking pointed questions/assignments or test to evaluate. For Second interview - no one showed up for 30 mins with no response. Interviewer was/seemed unprepared and told me that he had no idea about the interview. overall process was not professional and caused me frustration and wasted my time.
Interview Questions: How would you approach python programming? Not sure what he meant. No explanation after clarifying questions.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Applied 4 months ago and was reached out through email. After setting up a phone call, a zoom interview with the team was done. Fairly simple process, after they reviewed references they will let you know their decisions.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current position?

title: Crca Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA)
Interview Descriptions: 2-3 zoom interviews with team and PI, in person interview if team is in person. Interview with HR (they presented final offer). Few rounds of negotiations for salary. Overall 4-6 week turnaround from application to offer
Interview Questions: Interests, experience, background, future goals

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the Stanford Job site. Got an email for an interview a month and a half later for a phone screen. Did the phone screen and got ghosted. d
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? What are your greatest strengths? What are three words your coworkers would use to describe you?

title: Coach Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: One of the best experiences during the whole interview process. People are very caring and professional. Make it easy to decide whether to accept the offer or not in the latter process.
Interview Questions: What did you do when there is a team conflict?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very fun. The interviewer made it very easy to talk to them and asked interesting questions that weren't too difficult to anser. They were very accommodating. I interviewed with two people back to back.
Interview Questions: What was your favorite project you owned and why?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: I got a referral from my friend. It was a tree rounds interview. First two was 30-40 min and the last was around one hour. All questions were reasonable. I like the process, interviewers were kind.
Interview Questions: How Would Your Boss or Coworkers Describe You?

title: Administrative Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed and comfortable. Basic interview question. Currently just completed 3rd and final interview hoping I receive an offer. Expect to hear back and receive offer by first week of December
Interview Questions: Clarification of skills listed on resume?

title: Project Manager - Facilities Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: 1. 30 minute Phone screening with hiring manager 2. If pass, then invited to onsite interview with panel (faculty department members) Process can take a couple months, decided to accept different job offer so did not move forward
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? How do you manage dealing with different parties/groups/needs? Can you read building plans?

title: Marketing Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: About a 45 minute phone interview. Interviewer was very nice, easy to talk to—professional and personable. No major curveball questions. Seems like a great place to work. Felt all the questions were fair and not stilted or contrived.
Interview Questions: Q: Can you tell me something about yourself that isn’t on your resume?

title: Section Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Teaching interview + debugging interview. You were given the problem in advance and were able to prepare. Debugging interview simulated real life TA debugging scenario - key was to keep talking
Interview Questions: Q: Can you explain what a binary tree is

title: Talent Acquisition Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly team. I had a 45 minute phone screen with the hiring manager then a one hour panel interview with the team.  Unfortunately, I never heard back from them.
Interview Questions: Describe your learning and management style.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: One Zoom interview with the principal investigator and another person in the lab. Only 30 minutes and only one interview for them to decide who would get chosen. Very nice and professional people.
Interview Questions: What has your experience in labs been?

title: Bachelor-Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: The interview went well, with a friendly and brief introduction followed by basic questions on logical reasoning and my qualifications. It lasted a total of 45 minutes. The interviewer was a bit disinterested overall though.
Interview Questions:
What were your test scores?
What makes you a good fit for stanford?
What motivates you ?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, then got an email for a phone interview first then was invited back for an in-person interview. After a few days, I heard back that I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: How would I describe myself in 3 words?

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Kinda hard because I had no previous experience and they asked specific questions about my previous experience. It was only the first round interview. If you want to be successful, look up questions before hand and have an answer ready
Interview Questions: Q: Describe a time you improved a system of communications in your previous role.

title: Administrative Associate III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stanford University in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online and received a call from a recruiter the following Friday. Received a second contact the very next Monday setting up four interviews between Tuesday and Wednesday of the same week. Completed interviews and received email requesting references Wednesday evening. All references submitted Thursday morning and offer extended Thursday afternoon. 

It was a dream scenario. Not a lot of waiting and frequent communication.
Interview Questions:
1. Describe the best and worst boss you have in the past. 
2. How do you keep organized? 
3. What softwares have your previously worked with?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Stanford University in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: I had 4 interviews over Zoom with 5 different people. The process lasted 1 week and I received a request for references the same day of my last interview. 1 business day after they talked with my references, I received an offer which I accepted. Interviews were casual with many "describe a situation when you had to" questions.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had many ongoing projects / how do you deal with stress at work/ Describe a time you had difficulties with a colleague

title: Talent Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied to a job at Stanford on sep 8. Interviewed with them on sep 19 and 22. Hiring manager said I would hear back within a week. I sent the typical "Thank you" email: no response. When a week came and passed, I followed up with the recruiter: no response. I sent one last follow up email to the hiring manager on oct 5: no response After over month of absolute silence, I finally received the rejection on Oct 19th. My birthday of all days. I don't mind the rejection, it's the lack of transparency and communication that bothers me. To provide a good candidate experience, they should have kept me in the loop and send a quick update email to mention that they were still in the process of interviewing other candidates.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? How do you manage competing priorities?

title: Life Science Research Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Respectful and forthcoming with information and expectations about the role. First asked about personal aspriations as an applicant, then discussed responsibilites of the job, and moved into salary and benefits discussion. Very friendly!
Interview Questions: What are your professional aspirations

title: Senior Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: They use a combination of in person interviews and a video interviewing service where you record yourself answering questions. You cannot rerecord yourself answering questions so it was a bit stressful.
Interview Questions: What is your experience working with physicians

title: Event and Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: First interview was very basic, the second interview there were three people asking different questions pertaining to their own areas of expertise (marketing, social media etc).  Make sure to study up on the department website and study the job description as well! Specific questions will be asked about both
Interview Questions: What excites you most about this position based on the job description?

title: Development Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions:
Easy process, scheduling was quick. 
Interviewed with multiple people in one day, it was a combination of in-person and zoom, it was well coordinated. Everyone was nice. I heard back within a week, as they had shared. The manager was great at answering my questions.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
Administrative experience questions.
Working relationships, and conflict resolution.

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Informational interview for Office Administrator job. I met with a friendly HR recruiter and was able to ask questions about working for Stanford generally and whether or not my qualifications met requirements.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions:
There were 4 interviews. 
1 phone call with HR
2 video interviews with hiring manager - 1 about personality and 1 technical
1 in person meeting with team where they asked questions
Interview Questions: How would you handle scenarios with difficult customers

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions:
This was without a doubt the worst job interview experience I've ever had to endure.

I went through multiple rounds of interviews with the hiring manager and other team members. I also had to take a skills assessment test as well. Now this I don't mind, but it's the fact that the hiring team had such poor communication & tried to ghost me TWICE. It's pretty evident that they don't respect their candidates time at all.

I had to routinely re-schedule my interviews with them because they kept having time conflicts. When I put in so much time & effort in preparing for interviews & working on the skills assessment, I will rightfully be very pissed off  when you can't even have the common courtesy to properly let me know of any updates throughout the entire interview process & to add on to that, LIE to my face MULTIPLE TIMES that I would expect to get a response back within the next week, only for me to not hear anything AT ALL. If I hadn't sent follow up emails, I'm pretty sure they would've ghosted me.

If there's anything that I got out of this experience, it's that I know I essentially wasted a month of my life interviewing here.
Interview Questions: Q: A lot of behavioral based questions.

title: Summer Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: The mentor has a conversation with the intern about the program overview and the goal of research. Discuss safety requirements and necessary protocols such as parking permits, food and aggrements.
Interview Questions: what do you find internesting about this internship

title: Database Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by two people. It was pretty standard in the beginning- why you want to work here, my experience, why'd I'd be a good fit for the role.
Interview Questions: Why you would be a good fit for this role

title: Senior Compensation Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online at the end of May. I received an invite to complete a one way interview via a third party service (SparkHire). 

My one way interview was completed in mid June and I have yet to receive a response from anyone. Extremely frustrating. 

Job posting is still active.
Interview Questions: What type of quantitative and qualitative research methods have you used in your compensation work?

title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: So many unnecessary rounds of interview for an entry level position. The best part is the interviewer didn't even have the courtesy to let me know the outcome. This is after investing a lot of time in these interviews+ contacting my references . Didn't expect this from the bioinformatics department. They do not value the candidates time whatsoever.
Interview Questions: General interview questions regarding past work

title: Program Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process was engaging and went well, until I was ghosted... I believe there were three or four rounds total, I made it to the one before the last one, which involved some research on their program, creating a slide deck, and giving a presentation. 

I was told I would be contacted and informed of whether I was selected for the final round or not. I sent an immediate follow up and a one-week follow up - nothing. Never heard back, even several months later. Given that I spent a few hours prepping and conducting the interviews during an extremely busy week at my current job, I felt like my time was disrespected.

Seemed great - the people/team, the content, the organization. Unfortunately, the ghosting makes them come off as disorganized, self-important, or both.
Interview Questions: Why I want to leave current position, general experience,

title: Ph.D Candidate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: I got the interview in 2022, so it's on Zoom.  The interview process went very well. The community is extremely supportive. I can already feel the good community vibe in interview.
Interview Questions: There isn't a particular question. It's usually a very chill chat about science.

title: Crca Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions:
did 4 rounds of interviews
first with manager then team and team mates.
very straightforward 

Got a reply about decision a few weeks after interview and started the position within a few weeks
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here

title: Reunion Giving Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stanford University in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Went through a screening call and then a panel interview within a span of a week which was done through zoom. I had been referred to this role after applying for another position within the same department so I knew many employees already. I was told that I would be contacted within two weeks with their decision but was ghosted despite sending them a follow-up email.
Interview Questions: Do you have a preferred management style?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: This interview process is very standard, required a form to completed and discussion about interest areas. The professors oversaw the work and were very helpful in helping one understand the necessary requirements in the interview process.
Interview Questions:
Why did I take interest in this particular research assistantship?

What were topics and areas that I was focused on in the course of the RAship.

title: AV Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with the direct supervisor, not HR.  Since it was the supervisor of this position, they knew exactly what technical skills they were looking for and knew the language, which is great.  The supervisor was very honest about the position, which included extreme long hours and labor that's both taxing physically and mentally while the job would pay not quite enough to live in that area comfortably.  I apricated the honesty and was actually glad I didn't get further in the process as it would not have been a good mutual fit, and they picked up on that quickly and correctly.
Interview Questions: Acoustic Prediction Software experience and DB speakers rigging experience.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Was not very difficult. Asked questions about past and experience. Filled me in on work culture and what normal day looks like. Pretty normal interview in every way. Gave many details and they were informative.
Interview Questions: Do you have a salary in mind

title: IRB Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: There were 3 rounds of interviews. 1 on the phone and 2 in  person. No presentation was required. It was pretty basic and cordial. They preferred backgrounds that are strong in compliance.
Interview Questions: Behavioral, customer service focused type of questions

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Zoom call with the hiring manager and one of the clinical research coordinators. They were very nice and asked questions about my past research experience, teamwork skills, and timeline for this position.
Interview Questions:
Past research experience
Strengths and weaknesses

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions:
2 interviews and 3 references 
The first interview was with the Phd and the second was with the Principle Investigator (PI). After that they asked me for 3 references. 
I had to apply online ontheir website and they emailed me. The interviews were online/zoom and they were about 30-40 minutes.
Interview Questions: what were the hardest and easiest subjects in your classes

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: The process was straight forward. The questions were easy to answer and typical of what you would expect. The 1st round was a phone interview and then you went to in person.
Interview Questions: What do you like about your jib

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process is unlike any other. The process generally looks like this:
Application -> Course Proposal -> Vetting -> Course Creation

It's a very streamlined process and interviewers were very competent
Interview Questions: Background questions and TMAY (Tell Me About You)

title: Geology Department Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: I was sat down in a conference room with the Associate Director and the grad student that I would be working close with.  After a short interview I was given a tour of the Annex that I would be working in if I received the job.
Interview Questions: What does the flexibility of your schedule look like?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: The lab I interviewed at had a 5 stage interview, the last one was an all day interview which took 6 hours. I did not hear back for a month afterwards and only got a rejection letter after several follow-ups
Interview Questions: why did you choose to move from your previous research focus to the research focus of our lab

title: Data Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions:
Hiring Manager Phone Screen - Easy 
Interview with the team. 
Data Challenge.
Onsite team interview and offer extended 

My experience was okay, I think they wanted someone very senior for the role yet they had put entry-level in the job description.
Interview Questions:
1. About background and tools
2. Questions about SQL and Data Manipulation 
3. Scenario Based questions

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions:
First round standard behavioral questions based on S.T.A.R. methodology.
The situation, task, action, result format is a technique used by interviewers to gather all the relevant information about a specific capability that the job requires. Situation: The interviewer wants you to present a recent challenging situation in which you found yourself. Task: What were you required to achieve?
Interview Questions: Why are you a good fit for this position? Why should we hire you?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: I had three interviews in which I described previous experiences and what interests me most with current faculty. In addition I had to propose potential research projects. Very straight forward, yet a bit stressful.
Interview Questions: What is something you wish to study in your PhD

title: PhD Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: The PhD interview was conducted online. It was informal discussion with professors and current students. Current PhD students are passionate about giving you information about Stanford and department. Professors will try to convince you that Stanford is the best place for you to go and impress you with their research (because they are truly impressive!)
Interview Questions: What is your most important research experience?

title: Executive Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: 1 short presentation of work, 1 full day of interviews with faculty and staff (about 7 interviews in total) and a final strategic planning session that they asked me to lead
Interview Questions: Example of a time I had to lead a team

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions:
Never received acknowledgement of my interview thank you. 
Food for thought: to work in a role associated with DEI, does one have to be a minority? Can a white person work in a DEI role?
Interview Questions: What is one thing that you've done over the past year to keep your skills sharpened?

title: Qualitative Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to an initial 30 minute phone screen with the director, then invited to a 60 minute Zoom interview with another staff. I was then invited to a team interview but did not move forward with the process. Overall lovely people and straightforward process!
Interview Questions: Describe experience with software analysis packages and how you approach methodology, or describe a mistake and how you corrected it

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was a good standard process, informal feel, and felt very conversational. you interact with several players in the department and/or team which you will interact with regularly. the process was paced well and people were very responsive.
Interview Questions: questions about background,  interests, experience

title: Administrative Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to do all 3 interviews. 1 screening phone call followed by two virtual interviews. None of the questions were too difficult. I never heard back from any of the interviewers; even after reaching out to them.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Stanford?

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was relaxed, professional and engaged,  great deal of discussion of the position where my credentials fit in. No direct answer about when the position was to be hired. Never responded to email notes inquiring about the  hiring or position.. Except when they initiated the conversation.  It felt as thought they were dragging the process and gaslighting candidates to  keep them from going somewhere else.  (Because the contact was infrequent, but enough to keep you thinking you have a chance for the position.)
Interview Questions: what was your favorite position?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Due to Covid-19, my interview was held over Zoom. It was very casual and pleasant. The managers were kind, personable and encouraging. They shared about the position in great detail and asked about my background, values, availability, how I see myself growing with the organization, etc.
Interview Questions: Q: Are you a team player? How so?

title: Learning Experience Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Stanford University (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for the LXD position at Stanford GSB. It was a deceitful process from the start. The recruiter presented himself as a "business guy" and not a recruiter. The hiring manager appeared insecure and uncomfortable during the 1:1 interview. I am a woman of color with advanced degrees and can sense prejudice in such interactions. Both recruiter and hiring manager repeated ad nauseaum that Stanford "hired for the long term" and kept buying time by saying that their "hiring process has been delayed".  It took me a few weeks to realize they were not being honest. There was no talk of compensation and benefits. I received the ofiicial rejection after more than 3 months.  In comparison, my private sector interviews at banks and tech companies were transparent, efficient, and respectful.
Interview Questions: Q) Difference between working in private sector and at a university? Q) How do you work with difficult SMEs? Q) Why are you interested in this job?

title: Research Fellow Law School Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Unprofessional, Didn't have camera on, Other person interviewed from phone in back patio of a Café, Horrible Internet Connection, Cut me off when I asked my questions because they ran out of time
Interview Questions: How would you clean this data set?

title: Zero Waste and Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted for a screening interview with One Source recruiting. The interview was 45 minutes and covered my entire work history as well as specific questions that allowed me to explain how my experience would translate to the position. It was definitely more than just a typical recruiter phone screen
Interview Questions: How have you applied behavior change theory in your past experiences?

title: CS Bridge Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Was scouted by my professor for the program and then had 1 interview with Stanford representative. Passed the behavioral interview and was given the section leader job! This is not their usual pathway, maybe time pressure was involved here for their hiring.
Interview Questions: N/A, just conversation about myself and my resume.

title: Prospect Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Amazing and unbiased. My interviewer has so many things to flex yet still chose to be humble and proceeded the conversation with a 18 year old. I was nervous in the beginning but he gave me space to convey my sense and frequently engaged my phrases. I'm still connected to my interviewer even though I was denied admission.
Interview Questions: What inspires you? What you think you got for our campus? Ask me what you unable to find on the internet about us? Why Stanford?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Web came panel interview with three team members from the unit. The panel allowed enough time to ask the team questions about the department, position, and hiring process.  The interview was straightforward questions in a friendly interview process.
Interview Questions: Name a time you encountered a difficult situation with a patient or family member and what you do to resolve the issue.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford University (San Jose, CA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Two people interviewed me and asked me questions about my previous clinical experience in research labs. We also talked about some of the responsibilities involved in the role. I found out then that this role requires a minimum two years of working there.
Interview Questions: Q: Did you have any previous clinical experience?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: I was asked several questions about my background, and the interviewer asked me several questions to test my knowledge of Chinese laws. She then explained to me that the job required good language skills, which I have.
Interview Questions: 1) What do you know about Chinese law?

title: Kitchen Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very easy, straightforward and fun. Its not an intimidating setting which is great. They have flexible schedules too.  It is perfect for a student who works part-time.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: LSRP1, Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Went pretty well. Able to get along with my interviewers. The questions asked during my interviews are pretty standard for the job (description and from resume). However, Stanford mainly looks at your resume rather than your CV.
Interview Questions: What will your current PI describe you?

title: Resident Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: the second round interview is very unorganized and the questions are very repetitive.  During the interview, some of the panel interviewers were driving and unmute so it was very distracting. I just have higher professionalism expectations since its Stanford.
Interview Questions:
Crisis Situations 
Partnerships and Collaborations

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Stoic and impersonal the manager did not smile and appeared to focus only on one job.  The interviewer seemed uninterested in my background and to focus exclusively on experience in healthcare.
Interview Questions: Questions that were critical thinking and behavioral

title: CSA II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Had an interview with a panel of 6-8 people after meeting with my recruiter. Then had a one-on-one with the manager of my team.  Within 3 meetings, a decision was made.
Interview Questions: What do you do to relieve stress?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Redwood City, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
The interview scheduling process was smooth however after the interview no one cares to respond to your follow-up emails or even send notifications about the status. 
I had 2 rounds of interviews, in the first round I met with 2 interviewers and both of them weren't well aware of the job roles and technical duties of the BA. They had a set of questions that they had to go over and they recorded my responses. It felt really weird to appear for an interview where there is no interaction and they just focus on writing down my responses for review. 
The second round was with the director and again he asked the same questions. To be honest I was kind of bored and disappointed by the quality of the interview.
Interview Questions: The questions revolved around general project management tasks and were more towards behavioral

title: Social Media Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stanford University in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: I completed an interview with a recruiter, then had an interview with Stanford a couple of days later. I was told I would hear back in a few days but I was ghosted.
Interview Questions: If you were a company which one would you be and why?

title: Student Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: I made it to the top 2 for an interview process, and they told me they would be checking references, including my current supervisor, who was not my reference.  I expressed concern, because if I did not get the job, I would fear retaliation.  They told me they understood, but never reached out to my references and chose the other person.  This is SUCH an inequitable process and ensures that folks with toxic supervisors never get hired.
Interview Questions: case scenarios, typical interview questions

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer first described their research project and then asked basic questions to learn about my background in research. I was also asked about my organizational and time management skills. I was given time to ask the interviewer questions in the end
Interview Questions: How do you manage multiple tasks at the same time?

title: CRC2 Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Super friendly. I got to meet the team, doctors, and manager. Everyone asked great questions and allowed me to ask questions too. The interview was about 45 minutes long. The manager reached out to me a day later to let me know I got the position.
Interview Questions: Name a strength and weakness

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone screen, with relevant questions followed by an in depth in person interview with the entire team. Team operated off of pre-written questions that were asked of all candidates. Team interview was in pairs, and had 4 separate interviews, 30 minutes each with each interviewer pair.
Interview Questions: What did you learn from a chaotic work environment?

title: Event Planner Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (San Francisco, CA) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: First I had a screening interview over the phone. Then I had my first interview with the Event Manager over zoom. I was supposed to be called for the second round but they decided to move forward with another candidate
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths and weaknesses? 
Tell me about a time where you had to improvise in a challenging situation

title: Social Media and Design Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stanford University in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process was really quick - took about a week before I got hired. It started with a phone screening, a take-home test, followed by a video interview the next day.
Interview Questions: What is your design process? How do you handle feedback?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Standard questions, care a lot about CV and the interview felt like a formality. First year on the job was continuous interview as well. Really nice smart people  in the interview, happy to answer all questions
Interview Questions: Name a time where you had a problem and solved it

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: I've interviewed for a few (3) Program Manager level positions at Stanford, getting to the final round in each.  They've all consisted of a phone screen, a first interview, and a second interview.  Communication is generally slow and unresponsive, and two of the three times the hiring committee completely ghosted me.  The third time, my references were called and were positive, but I was not offered the position as another candidate had more experience.
Interview Questions:
Describe how you handle multiple competing deadlines. 

Describe a time you dealt with a difficult or demanding coworker.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was really relaxing. You get asked about a research paper and to explain the paper. You will have to answer some questions about the techniques used in the paper, and you may be asked about how to tackle certain issues of the paper
Interview Questions: What is the effect of the optimizer used in this instance? Why AdaDelta over AdamW?

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: I had a total of 5 interviews, both in person and over Zoom - all fairly standard. I got lost on campus looking for one of the buildings so plan extra time for parking and searching for the correct building.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to relocate for this job?

title: Image Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Was asked about former knowledge of image development and any prior coding experience but was not asked to actually code anything on the spot. Was introduced to the team leads.
Interview Questions: What is your understanding of image development?

title: StudentServiceSpecialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview consisting of 5 members. Lasted about 45 minutes. Back to back questions that test your answers.  Overall everyone was super friendly and challenged your answers. They were your usual answers. Couple days later I was back for a second round which lasted 30 min.
Interview Questions: What frustrates you at work?

title: Staffer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA)
Interview Descriptions: 30 minutes long. Questions included behavioral and tell me about yourself. Panel interview with 5 managers. The interview was over all easy if you prepare with stories and explain why you want the job.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you made a mistake and how did you fix it?

title: Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with three individuals from the Earth Systems Program. Scheduling the interview was easy and there were many available time slots. I'd say the interview ranged on the longer side-- maybe around an hour.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose to major in Earth Systems?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very rigorous interviewing process -- perhaps unnecessarily so. 1st round, Zoom interview with 5 interviewers. 2nd round, 8 straight hours of Zoom interviews including 10-person Zoom department meeting requiring significant advanced prep time to generate solutions to departmental issues.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you resolved conflict between researchers and how you accomplished that.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a bit drawn out, with gaps between interviews around 2 to 3 weeks.  It started with an HR screen, then to the hiring manager, then to a panel, back to the hiring manager, back to HR, then a decision.  From the first interview to the last interview was nearly 3 months.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were behavioral interview questions, and seeing how well you can work individually and in a team environment.

title: PhD Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Professors are nice, no difficult question. Prepare the general common questions and a little bit of your major project . Two professors from unveristy and one from your major. Dont over thinking the process.
Interview Questions: Why you choose Stanford University?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Long delay, said no initially then brought me back.  It was clear from start they were looking internal, so it was a long shot, and probably a waste of everyone’s time.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this role?

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
1. Phone call with manager
2. In-person interview with a total of 5 people (manager, program director, and 3 colleagues). Had to also present past projects that showcase my skills
3. Written assignment
Interview Questions:
1. Give me an example of a project you took the lead on
2. What skills would you bring to this role and team

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: I had a conversation with the PI. It was casual based on a job posting on an email list. We had an hour-long conversation then I was given the offer.
Interview Questions: What are you interested in working on?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: I had 3 one-on-one interviews with (potential) peers and executive director of a research center. I found it to be an informal, friendly and casual process, without any type of testing.
Interview Questions: What do you know about (relevant content area)?

title: CRC II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted on a Zoom video call. It lasted for 15 minutes. Asked basic questions about work experience. Explained the role and next steps. Asked a few relevant questions about my background.
Interview Questions: Explain in detail your previous experience.

title: Senior Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: The interviews were extensive. I had 5 meetings with the team, but everyone was extremely warm and open to share information about their work culture. They really wanted to be sure that their candidates would fit into the team dynamic.
Interview Questions: Q: How do you manage multiple projects with varying deadlines?

title: Research Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: It was really easy, care free, fun filled, joyous, full of candy, I love it so much, so so much!!  The interview was very easy and straightforward and I cant wait to work there
Interview Questions: How are you doing and why do you want to work at stanford?

title: TEACHERS ASSISTANT Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is very interesting and difficult depending on your current experience as a computer science student upon going into the interview beforehand. Overall good experience in doing this very interesting interview.
Interview Questions: I dont remember what they asked me.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a very smooth and intuitive process. The interviewer was very engaging and curious. A lot of questions about your interest in the research field. There were behavioral questions, along with conceptual questions about how your prior experience relates to the research topic.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this research topic?

title: UX Designer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: I made it to the second round. They requested a 10-minute video talking about myself. I never heard back from them after submitting the video. I believe after the first round an email stating you didn't get the position is best practice.
Interview Questions:
1. What is your experience?
2. Why do you want this position?
Etc.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process at Stanford is completely decentralized so interviewing in one department can be very different from interviewing in a different department.  So, characterizations of interviews at Stanford would probably not apply.
Interview Questions: Why do I want this position

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: There were two people. They were both very friendly. More of a conversation than an interview. They really just wanted to get to know you and know if you could do research online all summer
Interview Questions: Q: Why are you interested in Political Science?

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: amazing experience, friendly people, the process was very welcoming and they wanted you to succeed. I give it a 10/10 , all was done over zoom and there were 2 interviews with two different people
Interview Questions: tell me about a time where you struggled?

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was long and answers were elaborate. It was mainly talking about myself. I had to explain the role of a case manager and my expectations. It was hard trying to stay on topic and not talk in a tangent
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your background?

title: Student Services Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: First interview was with office manager, very relaxed. Felt more like getting to know each other. Second interview was in two sections: one with center director and one with six-person search committee. That one comprised more situational questions, which are always difficult for me.
Interview Questions: Q: Tell us about a time you made a mistake and describe what happened as a result.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Stanford University in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was not as intense as I was expecting. lasted 1.5 hours. Was asked questions related to my science and future goals. I didn't have a lot of time to prepare for the interview, but I speculated of what I didn't know, and I leveraged some questions they asked me by asking just as difficult questions
Interview Questions: How do you think your background would fit into Stanford's overall science agenda.

title: Phd Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with a number of different professors in predominantly relevant research areas. Each spoke about their own research and lab as well as asked about my previous experience and future goals. Overall, very friendly and aimed at finding the right fit for both parties.
Interview Questions: What was your previous research experience

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was nice, decent questions about the job and past experience. The interviewer described the position and expectations from the applicants.  It went well, but I still did not get the offer. Later, I received an email that the position was filled.
Interview Questions: Why would you fit for this position?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Demeaning, boring, frustrating. They were extremely rude. I was often left to fend for myself with little guidance. Literally, the last guy (accidentally) spit in my eye. It was a fitting end to the experience. 1/10, would not repeat.
Interview Questions: Can't recall what they asked me.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Emailed a professor and we set up a zoom meeting. We followed up with more zoom meetings with grad students, until I found a researcher who's interests matched mine. We collectively applied for an REU.
Interview Questions: What research are you interested in?

title: IT Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University (Redwood City, CA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was a 30 min screening call, then 3-4 rounds of 3-4 panel interviews with managers, and a last call with the director alone. Very long and tedious process
Interview Questions: Basic questions about the work, managing and conflicts

title: Laboratory Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: I sent my resume and cover letter to the Lab Manager, she contacted me for an in-person interview. I then went on-site for a very casual interview. The lab manager then emailed me a few days after regarding my offer
Interview Questions: General questions about past experience and interest in the lab's work

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: I had three Skype interviews with the principle investigator. I also emailed the lab members and discussed about the projects. The focus of the interview was on my interests and career goals.
Interview Questions: Why are interested in this position?

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Very standard. They fly you in for a few days to give a job talk and meet with professors and students. There are dinners and events to get to know everyone. They observe you teach a class.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in teaching here?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward process, there was an initial phone screening and then an invitation for a formal interview. It was over Zoom. There were 2 interviewers, one per session. It was 45 mins each session.
Interview Questions: They asked a lot of situational questions and questions about how to handle a particular type of person.

title: Senior Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions:
Muliple phone screens
Recruiter - decide if skills and background match and level of interest 
2 Hiring managers- asked technical questions , 2 Team members - discussed day to day, Good feedback after each round, After phone screens, in person interview, In person interview lasted from breakfast to lunch and met with dept head, senior managers, hiring manager and team members.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Pre-interview via phone at first. This was then followed up by an in-person interview for about 30 minutes. Pretty standard process and questions. Interview was done at the hospital and first involved a quick tour of the facilities.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this role

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: I initially had a phone interview with the hiring manager. The next interview was done via Zoom as I was not living in the area. It was easy to set up and the manager was again the person doing the interview along with 2 other team members.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were focused on my previous experiences as well as how I would handle various situations.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions:
Did a take home test, in person interview and then they got back to me in a week or so. I was given an offer

Did a take home test, in person interview and then they got back to me in a week or so. I was given an offer
Interview Questions: Don't remember the interview questions

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Wasn't too difficult and was mainly talking about the job itself rather than about my qualifications and all. I think it went good and was not too stressful. There is nothing major they can cut you on because its such an entry level position.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview application, I just completed an online application. Then, I got an email saying that I got the position. I was assigned to a faculty who needed a research assistant.
Interview Questions:
Describe your past work experience 
Share a challenge and how did you overcome it

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: I was invited by my employer to give a talk in person, visit the facilities of our research center and discuss the projects during a 2-day stay. So I flied from Europe to the US and back within a week.
Interview Questions: Research domain specific questions

title: ACRC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stanford University (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: After submitting application material I was contacted for a phone call with the hiring manager. After that I was interviewed by an ACRC panel interview. That was followed by a 1-1 interview with a faculty member. I was then contacted a few weeks later with an offer.
Interview Questions: Describe your most meaningful research experience.

title: Donor Relations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Redwood City, CA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews, one phone screen and one in-person interview. The in-person had a regular interview as well as skills tests for editing writing & videos and I think drafting an email.
Interview Questions: How previous work experience will help you in this role.

title: Applicant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was very laid back with me talking to an alumni about my experience for him to then communicate it to the school. He was very nice and came in as a helper rather than a hurter.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
What were your achievements in high school?

title: Page Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Quick, easy, and friendly. The librarians  at the library clearly care who works with the books and the interview was treated with seriousness but they were also very kind and understanding.
Interview Questions: Would you have time for this position?

title: Infrastructure Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Technical phone screen at first, then all day interviewing. No white boarding questions. Few behavioral interviews, peer pairing technical challenge and an hour long presentation on a technical project that includes Q&A at the end. The Q&A will be technical.
Interview Questions: Prepare a presentation about a technical project, and dive deep.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted within a week and scheduled an on-site interview. It's a one day interview process that I got to talk to everyone individually in the lab after my 1 hr presentation.
Interview Questions: why you choose us?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: It was a great interview process and the hiring process was complete and sound and did a great job at asking questions and was very friendly and nice and very nice
Interview Questions: What did you do before coming to Stanford

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: Not to difficult. They're looking for people who know what to do and can explain clearly how they will execute. It was a phone screening then a panel interview and later a final  review interview with the Chair of hiring committee
Interview Questions: What challenges do they think I will encounter

title: Research Professional Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: i submitted my resume and then they sent me a link to do a one way interview video recording through spark hire. I was able to do only one take for most of the questions
Interview Questions: why Stanford?

title: Stanford Accounting Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA)
Interview Descriptions: There was one phone call interview and 2 in-person panel interviews over the course of 2 to 3 weeks. The questions were mostly behavioral and situational questions. The hiring process took another 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you don't get along with a coworker?

title: Pre-doctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: I received a take-home data task which I completed in Stata. It was fairly straight forward and I had a week to work on it. After submitting my data task (both code and a write-up about my results), I did one interview with my future PI.
Interview Questions: What are your long-term goals after this position? What kinds of questions are you excited about answering?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process included a standard research presentation from your graduate work. There were also multiple 1:1 meetings with different lab members, which were fairly informal and a chance to ask about the lab environment etc.
Interview Questions: Interview questions were in regard to your lab work and presentation.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process included phone screenings, in person interview, and references. Ask clear questions about what the jobs really do entail. The overall interview experience was positive and pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: How do you work through conflict?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: After applying through Stanford career portal, recruiter reached out over email (over the weekend) to set up a 30 minute first round call. After a scheduling mixup, we finally connected and had a pleasant first round call. She'll speak with hiring manager and decide whether to call me back for a second round Zoom video interview.
Interview Questions: What interests you in working for Stanford University? Why do you want to work in a university setting?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I received an invitation to 5 back to back interview after filling in an interview survey through email and completing a phone interview. People there were generally nice and friendly though seemed not prepared enough. Several of them seemed like they didn’t know why they were there in the first place. The system gave an update that I wasn’t selected for the position. I wish they could show more respect for the candidate. I had to ask for leave with my current employer and then travel from San Francisco to Palo Alto for the interview. They didn’t offer any flexibility in letting me choose the interview date. At least they could do is to give me a call or at least an email to me, telling me that I wasn’t selected instead of just updating it in the system.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for an non profit organization

title: Facilities Specialist Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: The people I met in-person were very informative, genuine, and professional with their approach to finding the best candidate for this new role and I could tell really quickly that they were doing their due diligence to make sure that whoever they selected would be the best fit for the organization.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness while at work?

title: Communications Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions:

title: Communications Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I was called for a 30-minute phone screen then heard nothing for a long while. They then interviewed me, with the Woods Institute for the Environment's communications director and the Natural Capital Project director of outreach. They couldn't tell me their specific goals for the position so I spun some scenarios. Then they asked conflicting questions. That told me they either weren't entirely logical in their process or they had already decided on someone else. It turned out to be the latter. BUT: They asked for more work samples. I emailed them. And then never heard back, even when I contacted them. How hard would it have been to send me a form letter style email letting me know they chose someone else? I later saw via their website that they chose someone from an impressive gov't agency but without the skillset they claimed to require. It was all a waste of time---for everyone.
Interview Questions: You currently have a lot of clients and do many topics and tasks. How will you feel about working in a place with only one client?

title: Grad Student Interview

title: Cloud Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions:

Had the phone interview, approx 30 minutes.  Expected to be contacted to schedule another.
Heard nothing after. Not even an email stating the position was filled by another applicant.
I don't really mind (still currently employed), but I thought it was unprofessional.

title: Product Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: After 13 interviews with every member of the staff, I realized that they would be unable to make business decisions without group involvement.  I'm glad I went through the process to learn about their culture and how they made decisions.  We were not a good fit.
Interview Questions: Why do I have personal interests?

title: Development Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
This was one of the most intensive interview processes I have been through. I get that this is Stanford, but this is essentially an entry level admin role. 

I was screened by a recruiter, then took a timed proofreading test and a timed excel skills test. 

After that, I had another phone screening. This was followed by a two hour onsite interview which consisted of three group interviews. I then had a final three and a half hour onsite, where I essentially met everyone on their team for four back to back interviews without any scheduled breaks. 

Working with the recruiter was interesting to say the least. The info she had provided to her by their team was minimal at best. Itineraries were consistently sent last minute and even she seemed surprised by the number of people I met with in the final round given that this is essentially entry level. 

For the final interview, I had less than one day to prep myself mentally for meeting with nine people as previously I had been led to think I was meeting with only one person. 

I was barely informed about what the job actually entailed and felt overwhelmed during that final round of interviews. Some of the folks involved seemed very disinterested in what I had to say when they realized how different my background was. It felt very much like I was being talked down to when they began explaining things more clearly.

The person in charge of bringing me to the interview room really set the tone of the day when she first met me, as she was practically appalled when she realized I was the candidate. 

I could tell by the second half of the final interviews that I was not going to be offered the job.
Interview Questions: What are three of your biggest weaknesses?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: I applied for CRC position in October, then I got an email asking for a phone screening.  After the phone screening I was asked to complete a one-way video interview on Spark Hire.

title: Ph D Interview
