title: DW Architect Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a good face-to-face interview. The senior director of IT and a senior manager both interviewed me. The questions were directly related to the role and responsibilities. There was also another manager, who was a user of the data warehouse that interviewed me over phone. Overall, the interview was well organized and was well conducted.
Interview Questions: Tell me about the most complex technical challenge you have faced.

title: Communications Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stanford University in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, and emailed/sent a hand written copy of my resume. That is my standard operating procedure in all job situations. I was given and interview 3 days later and and offer by the end of that week. I am told this isn't really customary for the university though. There are some people that the process takes up to 6 months for. In hindsight a year later my anger is difficult and the office culture not the best, so perhaps they were just desperate.
Interview Questions: Nothing of consequence, most interviews at the university are straightforward and simple, no trickery. The university requires an extensive background check, I was already an on ca,pus employee and did not need this.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Two phone calls (one main supervisor, one ancillary supervisor to the job) followed by an in person interview with 4 people. There is a background screening process after the in person interview. If they've asked you to do the background screening, you've got the job pending that - if they say they're still finishing interviews a week after you go in and you haven't got a background check application, not looking good.
Interview Questions: Why are you a good fit for this job?

title: Senior Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: They were available to do the interview through skype.  They were very nice and asked tough, but reasonable questions.  I had to come in for a couple of interviews, but overall the process was pretty easy.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: quite simple steps for interviews
Interview Questions: not really unexpected questions

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: I sent my resume and they called me in for an interview. The interview felt semi-formal, they seemed to just want to know who I was and what my interests were in. It was very simple and not as intimidating as I would have expected.
Interview Questions: What are your research interests in?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: it will very much depend on the professor you would like to work with. The more popular he/she is, the harder to get in his/her group.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was an interview for 2 days straight, I guess this is good for you to know about the place and people you will be working with. It was hectic and tiring, but at the end of the day if you want to spend 3 to 4 years of your life here, you better get to know things and I loved the interview
Interview Questions: My research experience

title: Administrative Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had a fast pleasant experience getting hired at Stanford with my current position.  I had interviewed for two other positions at different departments and never heard back from either and l months later I received an automated reply that the positions had been filled. Stanford is VERY decentralized and there are many issues with their hiring process. People never follow up, don't email,  and they can take MONTHS to call back so don't hold your breathe.  My advice is don't give up, they have great benefits so the trouble is worth it if you appreciate a good work/life balance.
Interview Questions: They asked how do you deal with unresponsive faculty members?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Fairly basic interview process. The first interview was held via phone, the next interview was conducted in person with a small panel. The interview was based on behavioral structure, in which they asked me to describe experiences in my job history and explain how I handled various scenarios. Pretty standard.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your biggest professional failure.

title: Life Science Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had a panel of 6 people interviewing me, 30 minutes each. They were all very kind and to the point with their questions. It was a very transparent interview
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Got interviewed by team of professionals and also by team of current Resident Assistant and other house members. They gave me a pretty good idea of the place I would be working at. My main recommendation would be to be light-humored and go in with a relaxed attitude.
Interview Questions: What is my spirit animal

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Found a posting online and contacted the PI directly.  Had a series of Skype interviews with the PI and a call with the lab members. After that was offered a position.
Interview Questions: Asked to prepare a presentation on my own work in grad school. Was also asked to read a few papers and share my ideas.

title: Student Services Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA)
Interview Descriptions: 2 phone screenings by hiring supervisor. then small panel interview with deans. final panel interview with department staff. originally told my desired salary was acceptable, then told that HR denied it and offered me substantially lower salary.
Interview Questions: Can't remember the details, but at the end one person asked me something about my travel experience and wasn't sure how candid I should be about talking about a certain area or culture, since the staff (except this one person) seemed quite serious.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stanford University in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Waster of time. Most of the positions are "pre-filled." If offered a position, make sure to review your job duties or you will end up doing all the work for a department. Interviewers are unsure about the questions they ask and you probably know more than they do about the positions' responsibilities and outcomes.
Interview Questions: Do you have any questions for us (15 minutes into the interview)?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was selected for a telephone interview and spoke with the Associate Dean twice via telephone. I was then called for an in-person interview that included and interview panel consisting of a diverse group of future colleagues. I was asked a variety of questions and felt comfortable with my answers. I was offered the job out of 107 applications and several interviews.
Interview Questions: What makes you a good fit for this position?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview process, student library job
Interview Questions: None, it was straightforward

title: Statistics PhD Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Got a phone interview. The whole purpose was to find out if I can speak English.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University
Interview Descriptions: The first communication was a phone call from an HR representative. This was followed by a 1-hour phone interview. The questions asked during the phone interview where very basic computer architecture questions followed by a simple brain teaser. After this, an on-site visitation was arranged where I had eight 1-hour 1:1 interview with the different member of my new team. The questions varied, but mostly I repeated the quick presentation of my graduate research and answered questions related to that. Most of the people where very interested in the answers.
Interview Questions: The first communication was a phone call from an HR representative. This was followed by a 1-hour phone interview. The questions asked during the phone interview where very basic computer architecture questions followed by a simple brain teaser. After this, an on-site visitation was arranged where I had eight 1-hour 1:1 interview with the different member of my new team. The questions varied, but mostly I repeated the quick presentation of my graduate research and answered questions related to that. Most of the people where very interested in the answers.

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Visited campus for several days and met with many faculty members in my department, along with lab members in the groups I was interested in. Current grad students hosted us and took us out to dinner in Palo Alto. Lots of formal and informal opportunities to learn about grad school at Stanford. Interview experience and intensity will really vary by department, though.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: PhD Student BioEngineering Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA)
Interview Descriptions: FIrst apply. I did not meet all of the requirements of the PhD program. I was surprised to find out that no one really cared (I was missing organic chemistry). I was strong in all other areas and was able to justify why I should still be let in, however. Interviews were with 3 faculty members - 2 who I picked, one wildcard. Just show your enthusiasm for the subject and everything will work out.
Interview Questions: Why is Stanford the perfect school for you? Why not MIT?

title: Basic Life Science Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: was a day long affair, having to give a presentation of your earlier work to the group. Had to meet most of the people in the group one-on-one followed by meeting the head of the group who interviewed me on the skills and technical knowledge.
Interview Questions: what new techniques will I bring to the lab

title: Administrative Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, then received call a few weeks later for an interview.  Had an interview with the Human Resources rep of the department I applied for.  Following week I was scheduled for a mixed panel interview with a number of different employees in the department (various levels from other admin workers to heads of department).  Following week I received offer.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Submitted the CV and received email right away. Scheduled Skype interview. And got invitation to visit Stanford with a full day event, meeting with postdocs and department chair. Got accepted after visit and moved on signing paperwork.
Interview Questions: What's your expertise in stem cell?

title: Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
It was a long time before they responded to my job application for this position, but I was happy that they did. 

First it was a phone screening and the manager asked me about my previous jobs and experience as well as how I would respond to certain situations. The phone screening went smoothly and the manager invited me for an in-person interview right at the end of the call. Awesome!

I went to the campus and it was very beautiful. The buildings were iconic and the campus has the most beautiful landscaping I've ever seen.

I met with the manager and 3 other people and they all asked me a series of IT realated puzzles and some logic puzzles as well. There was even a practical where you get a client and you have to solve their problem. Over all I pretty much nailed every question and I had a lot of fun meeting everyone and solving the puzzles.

They said I would hear back from them in a week, but alas, that didn't happen...

Despite me doing well in the interview, I think what I did wrong is that I failed to follow up promptly... or maybe I came off as too cocky as I was flying through the questions they gave me...

Over all, Stanford would probably be the best place for me to work because I love to do IT at a place I really love and care about. Everyone is extremely nice and friendly. 

If any of you wonder if you should try to apply there, I say go for it. I didn't get my chance, but I will certainly try again later.
Interview Questions: Many different questions about IT across a multitude of platforms

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very casual.  People seems to be friendly, and asked a lot of project related questions.  It was a full day interview, meet with a PI in the morning, then give a informal 1-hour seminar on my graduate research.  Then went to lunch with the PI discussing his projects and my career objectives. In the afternoon, I meet with each member of the lab.  After a final meeting with the PI, several lab member take me out for dinner and discuss casual issues such as PI, working hours and style.
Interview Questions: What is you career objective?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was quite brief: (1) In-person interview with faculty member, (2) 1-hr seminar in front of your future colleagues, (3) meeting with future lab members and collaborators. It takes ~1 day to go through all these processes. However, it all depends which lab you are applying for and who the principal investigators are since, as far as I know, there is no documented interview process from Stanford.
Interview Questions: Previous work as graduate students, desired projects in mind, discussion on concurrent projects

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: My future supervisor invited me for a two-day visit, flew me from New York City and got me two nights at a nice hotel. On campus, I gave a seminar in front of a somewhat large audience. I got to talk to some graduate students, some professor working in related fields, and some post-docs. A really pleasant experience overall. I was aware that I was the only candidate matching the profile, because the job had not been filled for two years and my future advisor told me so. He also knew that I had other options, so he had to work to convice me to come.
Interview Questions: I did not get any questions really, it was more of a long ongoing discussion.

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I received an email to make an appointment for a group panel interview. Interview went well but after sending couple of followup emails, they took 40- 45 days to reply the result for the interview
Interview Questions: Your Excel skill, software knowledge and so on

title: Administrative Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: just fine.  didn't take too long but there was several layers to the interview so had to come back to the office 3 times.  also had to follow up myself and they were slow to get back but very professional and nice.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself.

title: Facility Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Good process, several interviews with many different disciplines.
Interview Questions: Why did you leave your last job?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview with division manager who serves as recruiter. In-person interview with 2 associate directors and division manager followed by in-person interview with 2 peers. Met in a conference room. They asked questions about what I knew about the position and the division (seeing if I did my research), about my experience with similar tasks, and about my previous jobs. Pretty standard interview.
Interview Questions: The only difficult question was a direct question as to whether I had experience writing grants, which I did not, but was able to explain other skills I possessed that would translate easily into grant-writing tasks.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with the manager and was then invited to meet with members of the department for whom I would work.  The individual interviews lasted anywhere from 20 to 30 minutes.  My references were also contacted.  Everyone was very professional and overall, it was a very positive experience.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?  Are you detail oriented?  What are your interests outside work?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Stanford University (Santa Clara, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Really straight forward..I just got phone interview and they asked me about my research and the projects that I have done. Wanted to know more in details about one of my project and asked some technical questions related to my project
Interview Questions: asked about my projects

title: Finance Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: VERY long.  Met with supervisor and team of peers.  Very standard. The manager was very easy to talk with.  The peers seemed average at interviewing.  Was surprised to get a job offer.  Did not think I interviewed well.
Interview Questions: How to handle difficult supervisor

title: Activities Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview consisted of a group interview with several other students. They asked each student a few questions based on their resume. These questions were about their teaching, teamwork, organizational, and diversity experiences. Then we were given a sheet of hypothetical scenarios and had to come up with solutions to these scenarios as a team.
Interview Questions: The most difficult part was working with everyone else in the interview to come to the same solution to the hypothetical scenarios.

title: Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Lot of hoops to jump through. Multiple interviews, each lasting 2-3 hours, meeting with various people back to back. A long process that gets you quite invested - which then really stinks if you are not offered the position. Seems to be a great place to get a job and settle in for a while - most employees had been there for years. Once in, good opportunity to move up/around.
Interview Questions: Describe specific examples/steps in creating process flow (for a process you have likely never worked with)

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the application system. GRE general and subject tests required, as well as written essay about my research background and plans. Before accepting offer, I flew to Stanford to meet with five potential faculty advisors and learn more about their research and labs. I also individually emailed with several faculty members.
Interview Questions: How will you contribute to the diversity of the incoming class?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Gave a job talk, met with direct supervisor, software developers and teammates.  Had lunch and dinner with other staff.  Had a follow up phone call with direct supervisor.
Interview Questions: What is your strategy for managing change?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: It is with my PHD advisor! So the interview is pretty easy!
Interview Questions: What are you going to do during your post-doc period?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions:
I enjoyed speaking to everyone in the group I was interviewing with.  

There was the initial phone interview that was pretty easy going.  And then a couple weeks later I was invited for an in-person interview, where I ended up meeting everyone I would be working with.  To prepare for the interview I had to do a case analysis which seemed easy to comprehend.  

I was invited back for a second in-person interview about two weeks after that to meet with those who are more senior, which I thought it went well.  A week later they did a background check and called my references.  They went through all that trouble of checking me, then offered the position to someone else.  I felt led on by them.
Interview Questions: Have you looked into our financials?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Great HR department - especially good at follow-up. Asked basic questions like, Why do you want to work at SMC?
Interview Questions: Why are you looking at SMC instead of a pure for-profit company?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: As I was hired from overseas, my interview process consisted of two interviews over the phone.  The first was with the hiring manager and the other was with a group of individuals who were directly involved with the position I was applying for.  They took turns asking questions over the phone and checking appropriate skills/experiences.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to the position?

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Kind of easy, I presented my data from the graduate school, had lunch with the PI discussing what I would like to do in the lab and after the postdoc, and then talked with some of the lab members
Interview Questions: All the detail about my previous publications

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Just exchanged emails with my advisor, got an invitation letter attached to the 4th email, met him at first day in office.
Interview Questions: No question asked, just resume review and explanation.

title: Human Biology Core Course Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: First had to submit a cover letter and letters of rec. Then there was a pair interview where you and the other person did role plays relevant to teaching/tutoring. Then the major interview you needed to design a short 5-min presentation teaching Human Biology faculty about a subject in biology - usually what you felt most comfortable in.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a student who is frustrated by not understanding a concept?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Hiring is decentralized and different departments handle it differently.  It's unlikely you'll have the same (Administrative-side) interview experience as a friend or acquaintance interviewing elsewhere on campus.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Process Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview first, and get on-site invitation in 2 weeks
Interview Questions: The phone interview is fair, just background check, the manager asks your experiences on your resume. Moreover, he also had some further question about semiconductor, such as why we are using CMOS as a inverter and so on.

title: Alternate Format Production Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process is meeting with the Alternate Format Production Facility Manager and answering various questions pertaining to job skills and familiarity with the various, relevant technologies available to the field.

Interviewee is then given a tour of what the alternate format production facility looks like and introduced to the senior members of the facility.

Hiring process is handled by a different employee/department and that is all handled and updated via e-mail.
Interview Questions: How familiar are you with using Microsoft Windows? Microsoft Office (especially Word)? The various Adobe Creative Suite products (especially Photoshop and Illustrator).

title: Medical Simulationist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3+ months. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied cold via online posting, got a call within a week. A phone interview was scheduled within a few days, mostly very cordial conversations. They flew me out from Chicago for a full day of interviews. Met director, associate dean, IT team, and other staff. Most questions were not terribly difficult. The facility was impressive, but rather stuffy. Campus was beautiful. I got a phone call with an offer about a week later. Salary offer was surprisingly low.
Interview Questions: Who would win a fight between Spiderman and Batman?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Stanford University in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: The professor will usually give you a trial period of a quarter, or even two quarters to decide if you are a good fit for the research group. To secure funding, sometimes you will need to make presentations about your project either to industry or funding agencies such as NSF.
Interview Questions: What research direction do you have in mind?

title: Assistant Dean Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions:
2 phone call interviews and 2 site interviews. Group interviews and presentation.
No test. background check. 1-on-1 meetings with various members of the community.
Quite philosophical questions. Extremely competitive process. So many competitive candidates in the pool.
Interview Questions: Previous work experiences, personal goals, future projections

title: Administrative Associate Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer did not ask any questions about my work history, interviewer did ask several times why I wanted to work at University.  Interviewer seemed distracted and not interested in the interview.  Interviewer said she would get back to me in two days either way, never heard back from person I interviewed with.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at University?

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Two day process. Met with 8 faculty, toured research labs and facilities
Interview Questions: What is your 5 year research plan? How do you see this organization fitting into that?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was very pleasant, quick and nice.
Interview Questions: what is you goal in future?

title: Student Services Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: professional, warm, courteous, the people were intelligent, perceptive, and were genuinely interested in myself and my past experience. Everyone at Stanford seems to function at a high level and it showed in their interview process. There is a reason that they are thought of so highly.
Interview Questions: Give an example of teamwork in your past work life

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Ask general questions about the class such as linear algebra or dynamic control system. I already knew the professor in person and he offered me a job and asked some questions.
Interview Questions: What is Kalman filter?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Reviewed previous education and experiences. Nothing unexpected. Had most of the conversation center around future aspirations and how I could directly help the project at hand. Did not require much screening because it was an internship but they were mostly concerned with my motivation for helping.
Interview Questions: How much research experience do you have?

title: Fitness Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: I expressed interest  in the position to a current employee before it was posted, so she recommended me and we exchanged emails to set up an interview.  The interview lasted 30 minutes (likely short because I had an employee referral).  After the interview, I was offered the job over email, and I went in again to fill out the hiring paperwork.
Interview Questions: How would you address a student that was not moving at the same pace as the rest of the class...both for a student moving slowly and a student moving quickly

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: Sent out email and resume. PI contacted me over phone and did an initial chat  and asked for references. PI spoke to references and called me back for an onsite interview . Put me up at a hotel in downtown Palo Alto. Did a Full day interview with his 20+ lab group.
Interview Questions: Describe what you want to contribute to the lab?

title: Finance Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer mentioned position after the phone interview.  Thought was talking to HR with live interview to come.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview process begins when you are admitted as a graduate student. In order to be admitted you have to submit  an application. Then if you're in the idea is to find an advisor willing to fund you. In order to get hired by a research group you will have to work on a project for a quarter and try to impress the professor.
Interview Questions: I had to develop an advection code during the quarter that is able to account for shocks.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: phone interview for 15min, ask for reference letter from my previous lab supervisor. Mostly talk about the new position and the collaboration with others lab at Stanford. After I ogt the offer, I start a lot of paperwroks for immigration and work authorization in US
Interview Questions: why I would like to come in USA? Do I want to stay in USA, and for along?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: An initial phone screen, written response submission, interview with direct manager, panal interviews with management outside of HR
Interview Questions: Why do you want to take a job that is a demotion

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Initially contacted professors via email asking for interview. Came and gave 30 min talk on research to entire lab. Spent day talking with graduate students and postdocs. Finished day with short talk with professors. Followed up via email to work on research project ideas. Settled on one and applied for funding together. Before funding was decided job offer was extended.
Interview Questions: Do you know how to tell if a paper is a real and important result or whether it is just a toy?

title: Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Very professional investment management organization.  Make sure you are versed in subject matter before interview.  Demonstrating passion in finance and investments is critically important.  They hire very well rounded and intelligent people and so make sure you demonstrate that in interview.  This is a great place to work and you will learn from exceptional colleagues.  Salary is good for an educational institution
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions:
The interview lasted 15 minutes (they told it from the beginning) and went in enormous temp.
I could barely answer the questions...
Interview Questions: What was your most challenging job?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a professor in my field who was looking for a postdoc with a background similar to mine.  We set up an interview for about a week later.  I met with the professor, gave an hour-long talk with Q and A,  met with different lab members and took tours of the labs, and met with the professor again; total interview time of about 5 hours.  The professor was obviously extremely smart, very driven and excited about the projects, kind, forthright, and positive.  The facilities and equipment were top-of-the-line, cutting edge.  The students were smart with personalities varying from laid back to intense, funny to serious.
Interview Questions: Technical questions about my thesis project and questions about my future goals.

title: Post Doctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Stanford University in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: I provided a good CV and cover letter, and was interviewed first on the phone and then on campus about my ability to teach the humanities.
Interview Questions: What I would do if people on my teaching team had different ideas about what to do about a student.

title: Basic Life Science Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Stanford University in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: It was a very pleasant interview. I first meet with my future PI and she gave me introduction into the projects i will be involved in, ask me very straight forward questions about my previous job and experiences and then introduced me to the members of the team who were also very pleasant. I like them immediately and was impressed with the whole group and was very happy on my job!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview process involved one-on-one chats with project managers, professors and the executive director. A coding task was required but was not discussed with evaluator, that is, the task was completed and scored independently. Much of the interview was a discussion of past research projects to determine alignment of research interests.
Interview Questions: No unexpected questions. Standard interview questions.

title: Head Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: I initially sent in an online application form.  I was contacted and selected for a phone interview.  Most first round interviews were done in person, but they were willing to work with my unique geographic situation.  For the final and second round interview I traveled to the employer's location and had a 2:1 interview with the assistant director and director.  Most of the questions were scenario and character based.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a homesick/crying student came to your room at midnight of the first night of the program?

title: Clinical Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Before I applied for a clinical fellowship, I did an away-rotation as a resident.  This felt like a month-long interview as I was constantly under the watchful eye of my potential team.  I ended up working a lot harder than most visiting residents because I really wanted to match at Stanford.  Overall it was a grueling month and I did not have to come back to interview.  Instead, I was pretty much told that they have been interviewing me all month long.
Interview Questions: I was constantly asked very technical questions regarding pathophysiology of diseases.

title: Computing Info Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Stanford University in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Your resume needs to pass the "keyword" test.  Usually phone screen by hiring manager, in person with numerous people who will be working with you and upper management (finalist only)
Interview Questions: Questions was regarding data analysis, best way to present monthly, over time.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed only with my professor
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: After applying for the job, I was contacted via email to set up a phone interview. The interviewer then called at the time scheduled and asked me a few questions about my past work experience and qualifications. This interview lasted about 25 minutes. After completing that phone interview, I was contacted about a week later to come in for a face to face interview. I met with two different interviewers for about 45 minutes each. After completing those interviews, I was contacted a day later and was extended a job offer.
Interview Questions: Can you give me an example of a challenge you faced at your previous job and how you successfully overcame and faced that challenge?

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: It is kind of weird of Stanford's policy of recruiting new hires. Typically you can only get the Stanford offer by showing you have another offer at another institute. Stanford does not want to be the first to give you an offer, it always waits for other institute to give you the offer first, and then matches with a similar offer.
Interview Questions: Which paper you regard the most successful one in your publications?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: PI called me to make an interview. First go through my research experience, then go into details of each period. for each period questions about details were asked. maybe it is not face-face interview, so quite many technical details were involved.
Interview Questions: why do you choose this group?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: I gave a job talk and met with several individuals int he laboratory I was applying for. Great interview with a clear display of career potential and with discussion of potential project and collaborations. Clear path to career development.
Interview Questions: Not sure there was one. i guess that most difficult aspect of the interview is related with getting the standards high for your presentation. Scientific standards are high at Stanford.

title: Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: Was simple interview with lab manager there and research coordinator PI.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Life Science Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions:
I was hired after a one year internship and brought on full time. Often Stanford posts jobs on their website when they already have somebody internally in mind. Also, the pay range is very broad for each position, so remember to negotiate hard. 
The best way to get hired at Stanford is to be referred by someone who works there.
Interview Questions: Explain all of your detailed scientific experience

title: Software Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford University in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: Easy, but it was 10+ years ago. EMailed, came to campus, chatted a while, got the job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Visitor Information Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: First, there was a written application. This was fairly extensive and contained about four essay questions. Questions pertained to knowledge of the school, personal integrity, creativity, etc. Next, there was a group interview. In this interview, former tour guides asked us questions that they commonly receive on tours. Next, there was an individual interview/presentation with the managers.
Interview Questions: What you say if someone asked you about the drug and alcohol policy on Stanford campus?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: 2 sets of in person interviews after telephone interview. Interviewed with approx. 14 individuals including peers, managers and directors.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a difficult coworker or customer?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford University (Palo Alto, CA) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions:
-He asked me to tell him about myself
-Why do you like computers?
    -I use computers every day, more specifically I use Google everyday whether it is the search engine, Google mail, and the Google App Engine
    -Described Google App Engine/my projects
Interview Questions:
-He asked me to tell him about myself
-Why do you like computers?
    -I use computers every day, more specifically I use Google everyday whether it is the search engine, Google mail, and the Google App Engine
    -Described Google App Engine/my projects

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford University in Jun 2008
Interview Descriptions: It was a very low stress process, however this is very specific to the area of the school I work in (and those I now work under). There was pressure on their end to hire someone and the process was quick. I had a short phone interview that led to an in person interview, 1:1 with 2 separate supervisors. It was a casual discussion about abilities, interests, and needs.
Interview Questions: No question was unexpected or difficult, all within my realm of experience and non-specific.

title: Accounting Specialist III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stanford University (Stanford, CA) in Jun 2008
Interview Descriptions: Didn't ask me any accounting question.  Just look at my resume and my past experience and probably called up a few references to make sure that I was employed there in the past.  It was pretty easy.  Also, the person who did the hiring and me had a mutual friend so I think that helped out a lot.
Interview Questions: There was no unexpected question.
